item.title: Topic 2: Questions about the Meaning of Life
item.description: In Plato’s Gorgias we encountered two conflicting versions of the meaning of life, and we discussed philosophy as an approach to questions. Now we turn our focus to what’s puzzling about the meaning of life. We can ask “What’s the meaning of life?” But that is just the opening move. What are the other questions we might want to ask in order to begin to answer that question? When we face difficult problems, often understanding the question is half the battle!

item.title: Topic 1: Philosophy
item.description: One of the most prominent living philosophers, Martha Nussbaum, was recently asked “How would you define the role of a philosopher in today’s world?” She answered: I wouldn’t. There are so many good ways to engage with the world, and each philosopher should figure it out for herself. I don’t like telling others what to do. Still, philosophy has a history. And its history involves people doing specific things and calling them “philosophy,” and not calling other things “philosophy.
